description: Long-term extension, beyond 2100,  for the SSP5-8.5 scenario.   Emissions are eventually reduced to a level that is found to produce equilibrated radiative forcing at a relatively high level by 2300 in a simple climate model. Concentration-driven. Radiative effects of CO2 disabled - i.e. the radiation code is fed the time-invariant CO2 concentration from the control run.
keywords: C4MIP, Tier 2, Scenario, SSP5, RCP8.5 extension, concentration-driven, 1850 CO2 for radiation
long_name: extension of biogeochemically-coupled version of the updated emission-driven RCP8.5 based on SSP5
rationale: To assess long-term CO2-carbon cycle feedbacks and CO2 induced warming associated with a high forcing scenario.
